ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours per week
4-6 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This was a great course. I felt that I learned a great deal. Particular strengths lie in the instructors' expertise in the field and our critical analysis of primary literature in lecture and discussion sections. Recommendations: the schedule was a bit disjointed, however that was not the instructors' fault considering that the large amount of snow during the early part of the semester significantly altered the schedule. It would be beneficial at the beginning of the course to hold review sessions on laboratory techniques discussed in the literature or take a short survey just to see the particular needs/background of that semesters' class.

The course is well-rounded with emphasis on both current knowledge and the future direction of disease vector control. The lectures are interesting as they are rooted in research and scholarly publications. The only recommendation is to provide the students with a better background in laboratory techniques (e.g., "experimental toolbox").
This was a really good course for students interested in vector borne diseases. It was good to look at various systems of insect vectors and think of ways the insects can be controlled
STRENGTHS-Very informative, and in depth-paper based model helps us understand how to try and answer hypothesisWEAKNESS-did not always convey the big picture concept easily
Did a great job of providing us with key information on vector control techniques and stimulating our own research into the subject.
S: the lectures and speakers

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brian l Weiss  This professor was excellent. He was very helpful, responsive to e-mail, and a pleasure to learn from.

Instructor: Brian l Weiss  Professor Weiss is one of the kindest professors I have ever had as a student. Despite my initial performance in the course, he remained understanding and approachable. He is also considerate and respectful toward all students. I am truly appreciative of the support and encouragement he gave me as a student in the course.

Instructor: Brian l Weiss  Dr Brian was a very knowledgeable and encouraging professor. He explained concepts such as transgenic insects on a clear and basic level.He made vector biology seem almost easy but you had to work to understand and think of how concepts can be applied to the field
Instructor: Brian l Weiss  Very knowledgeable and helpful

Instructor: Brian l Weiss  Very responsive to students needs and taught in a way that helped us really learn the material and come away from the course with an understanding of the subject. Fostered good conversation in the classroom
Instructor: Brian l Weiss  S: available for questions; friendly and funny; interested in the students careers; spread his interests to the students.
Instructor: Serap Aksoy  This professor was great. She was helpful and supportive of research project interests.

Instructor: Serap Aksoy  Dr. Aksoy is a kind professor with a great knowledge of disease vectors. As an instructor, she is poised and open to discussion with the class. She is understanding and supportive toward all her students. I am grateful to have both instructors for the course.

Instructor: Serap Aksoy  Dr Aksoy was a good professor who was very knowledgeable in the field of vector biology.Her lectures on the insect immune system and BT toxin among others were really insightful for application in the field of vector borne disease control
Instructor: Serap Aksoy  Very knowledgeable and helpful-both professors use their strengths to teach different classes
Instructor: Serap Aksoy  Very knowledgeable and also fostered great conversation on the subject
Instructor: Serap Aksoy  S: Has the answer to questions and open to suggestions

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: The TA was wonderful. She was very helpful, accessible, and her discussion sessions were both interesting and fun. She definitely went out of her way to assist the class.

Jennifer Gilbert is an excellent, excellent teaching assistant. She is supportive of all the students in the course. Jennifer was always available to students, whether it be for guidance on an assignment or a question about lecture material. She deserves much recognition for her efforts as a teaching assistant.
Jennifer was a good TA. she facilitated class discussions quite well and made time to explain concepts outside of class.It would have been nice to have more review sessions.
Very helpful
Great person to go to for help
Excellent TA, she always had time to teach us, offer her help in our papers and help us prepared for exams, good paper discussions, and always asked us questions to keep us engage in the subject.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course. It is a great introduction to vector biology.

Biology of disease vectors is a relevant course for those interested in vector-borne diseases, such as malaria and dengue fever. Although a strong background in disease vectors is not necessarily needed, it is a course that demands effort and interest in learning the course material. I would recommend the course to another student because it is well-taught and important to those pursuing a career in infectious disease epidemiology.
Take This Class
If interested in infectious diseases, then this class will help you clarify the role of insects on disease transmission. Totally recommended.
